bill_title: establish certain subclassifications for agricultural property.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish certain subclassifications for agricultural property. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 10-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The classification of agricultural property shall be further divided into the following subclasses: (1) Cropland; (2) Grazing land; (3) Other agricultural real property; (4) Recreational property; and (5) Transitional real property. Section 2. That chapter 10-6 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Terms used in section 1 of this Act mean: (1) "Cropland," any agricultural real property not classified as grazing land, recreational property, transitional real property, or other agricultural real property; (2) "Grazing land," any native grassland or land seeded to grass for at least seven years with a soil capability rating less than the county weighted average rating; (3) "Other agricultural real property," any parcel of land or real property that is being used for a large concentrated animal feeding operation with two thousand or more animal units as defined pursuant to 40 C.F.R. 122.23 as of January 1, 2005; (4) "Recreational property," any agricultural property owned or purchased for aesthetic reasons, the taking of fish or game, or other purposes unrelated or only remotely related to the operation of an on-going, for-profit agricultural enterprise; (5) "Transitional real property," any agricultural property which sells for more than three hundred percent of its assessed value.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
